b'Gendai Kibunroku Kaii Monogatari':
b'The horrid stories that remain in many conversations, the chilling urban legends come to life thanks to the Ga-nime.

The terrible anecdote of an old fridge thrown by a dried up river bed in \xe2\x80\x9cRefrigerator\xe2\x80\x9d.
 The grotesque encounter with an out of place sculpture standing on top of a building in \xe2\x80\x9cThe Dharma Statue\xe2\x80\x9d.
 The ghost encounter experience by a boy on a long bridge at night in \xe2\x80\x9cThe Night Bridge\xe2\x80\x9d 
A purchase at the flea market that brings a man to an ironic end in \xe2\x80\x9cUS Army Surplus\xe2\x80\x9d
 The enigma of continuous deadly accidents near a railroad in \xe2\x80\x9cThe Railroad Crossing\xe2\x80\x9d 
The mysterious experience of a boy on summer vacation in a peaceful countryside in \xe2\x80\x9cI Want Friends\xe2\x80\x9d. 

6 pieces of horror put on 1 film. The Japanese urban legends, put on screen in the characteristic drawing of KIMURA Toshiyuki, whose fame reaches outside the borders of Japan, call for a scream, with the talented collaboration for the ending theme of an artist produced by SUDOH Akira, Leilani. 

(Source: Toei-anim.co.jp)'
